conclusion: Objects A and B, each with a mass of 1kg, are attached to the two ends of a massless string passing over a pulley on an inclined plane with angle 37 degrees.
Object A is initially 1m above the ground, object B is at the bottom of the inclined plane, and friction is negligible.
The system is released from rest and the connection between object B and the string breaks when object A hits the ground.
The task is to find the time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane after the connection breaks.
Calculate the acceleration of object B on the inclined plane using the component of gravitational force along the plane.
Use the equation of motion to find the time taken for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane.
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is 1.25 seconds.
